message: I think social media "experts", social-media analytics tools, social-media consumption tools ... etc, are highly overrated, and so I wrote a rant to explain why - http://impulse.kirillzubovsky.com/post/4210243178/social-media-nonsense

There will always be hype when something new comes. I remember Accenture charging $1M to do a prototype web site during the dotcom bubble. That phase has passed and the current phase of social media will also pass and people will find the real use of it.

Experts is a tag that has been over used and equally over vilified. Social media is another tool at our disposal, and to be honest is not really new. Just because we change the nomenclature, added new tools, and have increased adoption and awareness does not make it new. It is part of a healthy marketing mix, not a magical unicorn.

@kevinmullet agree - social web opens by socialising through the whole world new doors, which are shut advertising in local press, radio or tv. Only shouting the own message will not be enough in future. People like to interact with people.
I agree with everything @kevinmullet has said.
